reviews.review:
Much more fun than what i thought it would be. 
Some people might say this game is a bit to short... well once you finish the main story you still can complete 3 bonus maps AND try to complete other chambers that you've already completed in...
1) the fastest time 
2) the least amount of portals used too.

7.5/10

A game where you disrupt the space-time dimensions to travel between orange and blue wormholes through the use of some kind of anti-matter powered space dimensional warping gun thing that can't kill anything even though it is supposed to be a gun, which is like a sword that can't cut or pierce, like how does that even make any sense.

You go around using metal blocks with heart tattoos all over it to deflect gravity defying balls of plasma or something, robots shaped like the gun itself except if the gun did not have a handle and it was oriented vertically with the opening claw thing as the legs. And if it had arms. and if it talks. and if it had guns, and lasers and.... There is also some green sludge at the bottom that if you fall into you die probably because it smells so horrid or maybe because it is green and we all know green is bad, just like vegetables.

Basically the game is like this, get from point a to point b. With this robot lady nagging you all the time about some cake or whatever, robots shaped like guns shooting guns, avoiding balls of plasma that activate doors, using cubical shaped objects to do what cubical shaped objects do, like dying in a fire, while avoiding green puke on the ground while warping space-time itself so that you can get from point a to point b. Seems simple, all you do is shoot that gun and warp the space field around the walls because worm holes on mid air could prove disastrous, creating a black hole and destroying the entire universe and blowing up your computer. It happened to me, twice. Remember do not try to open portals in the air.

Graphics - 8/10
Gameplay - 9/10
Annoying robot voice - 2/10

Also there is no cake in this game, so overall score:
0/10 (No cake for you)

Now go buy this game and your own cake.
Portal in general is the best puzzle game I've ever expirenced. This game itself however is exetremely fun and intresting and can easily get players hooked on it.
Amazing game. If you haven't played it, what are you doing with your life?
Portals! must own if you're a puzzle fan. Gameplay is one-of-a-kind, visuals are spectacular even today.
Short but fun.  Perfect for anyone looking for a cool take on puzzle games.

Ein kurzes (ca. 1h Spielzeit) und recht einfaches Spiel (zumindest die Grundstory) mit netter, aber nicht besonderer Grafik, einer sehr sch√∂nen Gameplaymechanik der namensgebenden Portale, die auf viele verschiedene Wege genutzt werden k√∂nnen und sich oft sehr echt anf√ºhlen. Besonders zeichnet es sich auch durch seinen Charme und Witz und auch die versteckten Hinweise aus. Nicht ohne Grund ein Klassiker geworden.

[b]Portal te brinda desde situaciones logicas hasta insanas para probar tu inteligencia.Es aqui donde podras probar tu ingenio en soluciones rapidas.[/b]
Es un excelente juego,basandose en su corta historia y basica explicaci√≥n del juego:
_La jugabilidad: Muy abierta aunque con un unico final,recorriendo un unico camino,con trampas y secretos incluidos.  9.5/10
_Los graficos: Contiene la primer version del motor Source (desarrollado por Valve),el cual esta bien dise√±ado desde los reflejos hasta los objetos que se pueden mover y por supuesto los portales. 8/10
_La trama: Simplemente consiste en superar desafios unicamente con portales. 9/10
_Soundtrack: Al transcurso del juego se pueden notar distintos estilos de m√∫sica relacionada con la situaci√≥n en la que estas.Por ejemplo en la primera c√°mara, la m√∫sica es m√°s bien suave; en cambio, en cuando estas por ser incinerado,la musica se vuelve mas rapida. 10/10
Si lo vas a comprar te recomiendo que lo hagas cuando hay ofertas.
great game!

Perfect game. No problems.

2018 Update: Still playing :)

All praise and accolades given to this title are well-deserved. A fantastic title in its own right, owing to the successful development process stemming from concepts in student project Narbacular Drop, Portal combines the best elements of puzzle, storyline and iterative design - from start to finish it delivers challenge after challenge and awards great satisfaction in the completion of each test. The sarcastic writing and simple mechanics that build upon one another draw you in like nothing else, to the point that you forget nearly the entire game serves as a tutorial, excluding the last few levels. Its equally successful sequel aside, Portal stands on its own as a testament to user feedback and the value of beta testing to create a hallmark product.
It's fun, and requires common sense.
Cool puzzles, need a brain to play and cake is a lie 10/10
Un juego completo, unico, espectacular, donde tu mente perder√° la mocion del tiempo y te divertiras creando un portal por aqui y otro por all√°. un juego que jugar√≠a una y otra vez.
BETTER THAN PAC-MAN

Portal is an amazing first-person puzzle game. Stuck in the depths of Aperture labs, you must complete test chambers using only a portal gun. You can interact with many different test elements such as Aperture Science Weighted storage cubes, high energy pellets, and many more things. Will you complete all of the tests? Or will you go down into flames?

Questo gioco √® davvero magnetico, ho cominciato a giocare una sera e ogni qual volta accedevo a un nuovo livello volevo continuare per scoprire cosa c'era dopo. Lo consiglio vivamente, non ho avuto problemi neanche con i comandi, che sono pochi e semplici.
Un mondo di piccoli labirinti, di portali, ma sopratutto una voce magnetica che ti segue ovunque tu vada.. sar√† buona?

Great puzzle game! 

Highly recommend this game with  the portal bundle which includes portal 2 which is even better

Let me begin by saying that I absolutely hate first person perspective in games. However I absolutely loved this game. While it was short, I still thoroughly enjoyed blasting through the levels with that quirky computer chick in my ear. I see myself purchasing the sequel in the near future.

So I'm quite new to gaming and portal was recommended to me by a friend. I've played a good few hours now and I find it so addictive. Its a great game! I don't find it too difficult that it makes me stop playing but it really gets you thinking about how to solve each chamber/ level. Its funny, adventurous and I like the graphics and controls. It is very quick to get the hang of. Overall brilliant game and I would highly reccomend it! =)

Escribo esta valoraci√≥n disfrutando ya de la secuela del juego que aqu√≠ nos ocupa. ¬øNo os parece motivo suficiente para lanzaros a por el primer Portal? Esperad y leed.

Me hice con √©l durante las pasadas rebajas veraniegas, a precio de ganga, por recomendaci√≥n expresa de un gran amigo. Aunque esc√©ptico al principio, dado el g√©nero al que pertenece, decid√≠ darle una oportunidad e instalarlo. Esta creaci√≥n de Valve hizo el resto: descubrir, conduciendo a Chell, los inventos e instalaciones de Aperture Science, as√≠ como su rivalidad con Black Mesa; una gran dosis de humor negro y sarcasmo personificada en GLaDOS... sin olvidar sus puzzles, claro. Algunos de ellos suponen un verdadero reto para el jugador.

No lo dud√©is m√°s. INDISPENSABLE en cualquier buena biblioteca de Steam.
"Ch√©ri, ferme le Portal en y allant !"
Still epic and still alive.

I would recommend Portal to any lover of puzzle games. The inclusion of the advanced chambers and the challenge maps helps give the game more replay value, since it's actually quite short. I think one of the best parts about this game is the dialogue; GLaDOS has some of the best lines I've ever heard.

Still a great game after all these years - it has aged very well and doesn't seem dated at all. 

Fairly short compared to Portal 2 (which goes a bit further with slick-bouncey goo). I finished it in about 7 hours.  Quality over Quantity and for a low price its well worth it.  For anyone who likes puzzles, physics, strategy...this is a must like Talos Principle.

I am really not a game player, but my brother-in-law is. He introduced me to Portal. I didn't have a "gaming" capable PC at the time, but I purchased Portal for Linux and tried it on my Intel i3 laptop. As stated, this isn't a gaming rig, so I didn't play much. Recently purchased a new iMac Retina 27 inch "maxed out". Downloaded/installed Portal and started where I left off. Completed Portal last night.

Portal is an incredible game. The graphics are very impressive, and the thought put into creating Portal simply blow me away.

**AVISO** Este mierdian√°lisis puede contener alg√∫n spoiler que otro.

Comienza la saga de Portal, con este juego lanzado en 2007.

Comenzar√°s en una peque√±a habitaci√≥n con cama y retrete, y alg√∫n tipo de robot con la voz un poco trabada explic√°ndote cosas. Empezar√°s con los t√≠picos saltos entre plataformas, hasta conseguir la 'Portal Gun', tras ello, a poner portales, y portales, y m√°s portales, porque de esto trata el juego, o creas portales, o no sales del nivel a no ser que seas el nuevo Houdini, que lo siento, pero lo dudo.

Tras estar cerca de una hora pasando niveles de iniciaci√≥n, llegas a un nivel, que para m√≠, fue medio imposible, el nivel 17. Desde el principio tienes que estar atento a todo lo que te rodea, y crear alg√∫n portal que otro por si m√°s adelante, cuando veas lo que se te viene encima, tienes que volver al principio, y esto mismo pasa con los dos siguientes niveles, pero una vez pasado el 17, los otros dos son risas.

Tras terminar la preparaci√≥n a la que te somete GlaDos, esta te quiere eliminar de una forma muy sencilla, arroj√°ndote al fuego. En esos escasos segundos tienes que encontrar la forma de escapar con vida hacia otro lugar para no caer en las llamas y a partir de aqu√≠, comienza la trama del juego, d√≥nde en realidad, te acabas dando cuenta que no eres m√°s que un simple tipejo (en este caso tipeja, porque controlamos a una chica) que ha sido utilizada para ver si eres lo suficientemente inteligente para conseguir pasar las pruebas. 
Tras escapar de la plataforma que te lleva a las llamas, solo queda escapar y utilizar todo lo aprendido durante los 19 niveles para escapar con vida del complejo de 'Aperture Laboratories', con una GlaDos un tanto por culera que no para de "putearte" y decirte que no eres capaz de salir de all√≠.

Tras darle duro a GlaDos en una "√©pica" batalla final (hacer portales para que unas misiles impacten en ella xD) lograr√°s salir de los laboratorios pero...algo te encontrar√° y te arrastr√°, y entonces...FIN (hasta la segunda parte, claro est√°).

Jugabilidad: 7.5
Diversi√≥n: 8.5
Sonido: 9 ( canci√≥n del final: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TnkyR5smlXo )

Portal fait partie de ces jeux dont on entendra parler pendant longtemps et qui doit appara√Ætre dans toutes les bonnes biblioth√®que de jeux vid√©o.

The cake is a lie! 

However, the hype behind Portal is not.  When I first installed this game, years ago, I was too young and too impatient to appreciate the nuanced and intellectual puzzles that are the heart of the gameplay of this title.  

If you take a little time, you'll find something very original and stimulating, and funny.   If you don't like to get frustrated, or if you are the type that gives up easily on a puzzle and searches for the answer...you won't find this game to be fun.

If you have the patience to inspect, re-inspect, and re-re-inspect a room for that one puzzle element you missed, or didn't think about, and you have the wish to be rewarded and have the "EUREKA!" moment when you finally realize that bit of wall hanging at an odd angle isn't there just for show...and you, in fact, have to teleport in a loop of gravitational frenzy to catapult yourself from said wall across an impossible chasm into the hands of awaiting freedom (not), then you'll love it!  

It's all about the intelligence.  Artificial, or otherwise.
